byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Russ Buettner, David W. Chen, Mosi Secret and Kate Taylor.

abstract: New York City Housing and Preservation and Development assistant commissioner Wendell B Walters, who is responsible for new construction, is arrested, along with six developers, on racketeering, conspiracy and related charges; charges against Walters represent another black eye for administration of Mayor Michael R Bloomberg, whose third term has been clouded by controversies involving senior officials.
snippet: Wendell B. Walters, a New York City official in charge of new construction at the agency that helps build low-income housing, was arrested on racketeering conspiracy and bribery charges.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Department of Housing Preservation and Development (NYC)

lead_paragraph: Wendell B. Walters, a New York City official in charge of new construction at the agency that helps build low-income housing, was arrested on racketeering conspiracy and bribery charges.

headline.main: City Official Accused of Taking Bribes, Left in Boxes and Cups
headline.print_headline: City Official Accused of Taking Bribes, Left in Boxes and Cups
headline.seo: N.Y.C. Housing Official Is Among 7 Charged With Bribery
